column4: Could anyone please help me with my modem problem. I have the drivers installed which I got from the manufacturer and wvdial keeps saying Modem Not Responding. Can anyone help me?
Intel 537EP
love to help but gotta go soon. sorry.
thanks, you were helping me last night but I couldn't do what you suggested because I have no Internet access on Ubuntu.  I put in a different modem today hoping to solve the problem.
externals are the troublefree way... if you have one.
they are 'real' modems.
yes, I know, I will have to eventually invest in one.
any external modem will do fine (usually). because they do the DAC digital to analogue conversion in hardware not software.
Do you have cable Internet or dial-up. If dial-up, what modem do you have that works with Ubuntu
i have had every external modem work with linux.
it just gets recognised.
Yes, I am sure all externals work, I was just wondering if you or anyone has an internal modem that they've got to work with Ubuntu
sorry. been some years since i've needed too.
What external modem is best to get: serial or USB
I would guess USB but thought I would ask.
SERIAL!!!!!!!
OK, Thanks :)
serial's been working A1 for a million years and you arn't worried about bandwidth.

Just to let you know, in the Ubuntu Forums I found this link http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=36762&highlight=Modems which is a person with the same Intel 537EP modem as me and he has downloads and steps to install.
nice one man. now you are the internal modem guru :0
I will let you know if it works
do. that's interesting.
